content.description:
Steep Climbing with variations under a treed ledge, hang a left to wind around rock features and back up right to the anchor.  Fun.



Located about 20m South of Choosen Men. 

Standard Ice Rack

climbs.name: Choosen Men
climbs.fa: Matthew Peck, Dave MacFadden, Christopher Newell, Feb 27 2019

content.description:
Climb the icy ramp past a pillar to a ledge.  Belay on twigs here or continue up a very thin and delicate ramp to the left to trees. 



Located just right of Fisher Gully, start from the same belay. 

Thin Ice Rack.

climbs.name: Fisher Gully
climbs.fa: Matthew Peck, Kristen Fisher, Leanne Fisher. Feb 2014

content.description:
A beauty of a gully.  A nice long easy line, sometimes with thin ice, but trees are slingable the whole way. 



About 100 m Downriver of 3 sisters

Standard Ice Rack

climbs.name: The Fisher Traverse
climbs.fa: FFA Matthew Peck and Derek Hatfield, Feb 2014.

content.description:
A funky Girdle traverse sometimes over open water. Place pro often or you or your second could wind up in the drink! Fun but surprisingly technical. A dropped quickdraw on the FA lead to some icy fishing.



Start from the rocky outcrop downriver of The Goggles and head upriver till you run out of ice!

Standard Ice Rack

climbs.name: The Goggles, They do Nothing!
climbs.fa: FFA Matthew Peck, Kristen & Leanne Fisher Feb 2014.

content.description:
Traversable from the Fisher Traverse Belay, or traverse and set a hanging belay if ya like! Climb the obvious ice just downriver of Fisher Traverse, just before the rocky outcrop. Nice. A second on this climb knocked a lens out of Leanne’s glasses on the FA, ice climbing can be expensive!



10m downstream of Sink or Swim

Standard Ice Rack

A large bowl of ice with a southern aspect.  Some nice pillars near the top. 



About 200m Downriver from 3 sisters.

Standard Rack

climbs.name: Pitchfork
climbs.fa: Matthew Peck and Kristen Fisher, Feb 2014

content.description:
A short pair of pillars with longer verts than Two Stepper. Left is longer but easer typically. Good to work on your vertical game. A short scramble will take you up right to the Warmup Scramble.



20m Upriver of Warmup

Standard Ice Rack

climbs.name: Sink or Send
climbs.fa: Derek Hatfield and Matthew Peck, Feb 2014

content.description:
The First Steep Ice below the East Branch. If there is ice in the river, belay from the river ice, otherwise hanging belay. Climb up the two pillars, finding all the steepest bits. 



Directly opposite Swimming Lessons. 

Standard Ice Rack.

This cool route will get your motor running.  Climb the apron of ice while headed to the obvious pillar.  Tree anchor above.  The pillar is often brittle and delicate, so tread carefully!  Climbs the right side typically.  Top rope is easily accessible via Fisher Gully. 



Downriver about 75m from 3 sisters. 

Thin ice Rack.

Three variations of excellent climbing terrain.  Typically the right sister comes in first.  



20m Downriver of Warmup. 

Standard Ice Rack

A good start to the day.  Easy climbing with access to the top of the East Bank.  Descent “trail” involving some technical downclimbing that can be used to access the top or bottom of the East Bank is located just upriver. Scrappy climbing over a log left of Warmup.



Directly opposite Two Stepper.

Standard Ice Rack
